pronunciation: PLAT, [from plait, or plat flat.]To [Latin latus; or from the root of place.]

definitions.text:
Plat
 weave; to form by texture. Matthew 27:29.
PLAT,

small piece ground, usually portion even ground; as flowery plat; willows.
PLAT,

Plainly; flatly; downright. [Not used.]
1. Smoothly; evenly. [Not used.]
